nodes.text: Cadinth was one of the original worlds in the Kingdom of Cron, and later Xim's empire. At the time of the Galactic Empire, Cadinth was a wealthy port and desert world in the Allied Tion sector. Its natural beauty was destroyed by industrialization, as was that of its neighbor, Lianna, leaving deserts of black sands and howling winds. Scattered in the wastes were the ruins of ancestral civilizations. Its population was concentrated in gloomy, sharp-featured cities that self-consciously evoked the distant past.

Prior to 25,150 BBY, Cadinth was the capital world of one of the ancient Tion Cluster states: the Kingdom of Cadinth. Cadinth later allied with the Kingdoms of Jaminere and Barseg, creating the Three Allied Kingdoms. Pirate King Xer VIII waged a campaign against the kingdoms between 25,150 BBY and 25,130 BBY, defeating the Kingdom of Cadinth at the Battle of Cadinth. Cadinth and the Three Allied Kingdoms worlds were conquered and absorbed into Xer's Empire, and later Xim's empire. Thus it became the Third Throne world of Xim.

After the collapse of the empire in 25,100 BBY, the world joined the ancient Kingdom of Cron. After the Tionese War, Cadinth and the entire Tion Cluster joined the Galactic Republic. In the Republic's final years, the Tion Cluster worlds joined the CIS, and were later subjugated by the Galactic Empire.
The Cadinth Oligarchy decided that the planet would remain "firmly undecided" between the Separatists and the Republic. Cadinth was later the site of the Battle of Cadinth in 6 ABY.
Mission to Lianna places Cadinth in the Allied Tion sector, but HoloNet News Vol. 531 55 places it in the Mid Rim.
